STUDENT SUCCESS HUB DOCUMENTATION
Configure the Student Success Chatbot in Einstein Bot Builder

Complete these chatbot setup tasks in Einstein Bot Builder.

Update the Chatbot's Name
By default, the Student Success chatbot is named Student Success Chatbot. The chatbot's name appears in the bot's initial greeting to the student. Update the chatbot's name for your institution.
Update the Chatbot User
To allow the chatbot to perform actions in your org, specify a Bot User based on the chatbot security approach that you decided to take.
Set Up the Chatbot Channel
Before you activate a chatbot, it needs to know where to work and how to work. Give the chatbot its work orders by assigning it to the Chat channel.
Update the Chatbot's Branding
Configure the chatbot window's general branding on the Embedded Service Deployment page.
Customize Chat Dialogs
Dialogs are conversation snippets that consist of outgoing messages, questions, actions, and rules. Dialogs control what a chatbot can do.
Activate the Chatbot
After you've configured and customized the Student Success chatbot, activate it.
Update the Chatbot's Name

By default, the Student Success chatbot is named Student Success Chatbot. The chatbot's name appears in the bot's initial greeting to the student. Update the chatbot's name for your institution.

From Setup, search for and then select Einstein Bots.

In the My Bots section, click Student Success Chatbot.

From the Bot Builder menu, select Overview.

In the Bot Information section, click Edit.

Update the Bot Display Name.

Save your changes.

From the Bot Builder menu, select Dialogs.

From the navigation pane, select the Welcome dialog.

Edit the first welcome message that includes the chatbot's name.

Save your changes.

Update the Chatbot User

To allow the chatbot to perform actions in your org, specify a Bot User based on the chatbot security approach that you decided to take.

See Set Up Security for the Student Success Chatbot.

From the Bot Builder menu, select Overview.

In the Settings section, edit the Bot User card, and then select Custom Chatbot User.

In Custom Chatbot User, specify the user.

Save your changes.

Set Up the Chatbot Channel

Before you activate a chatbot, it needs to know where to work and how to work. Give the chatbot its work orders by assigning it to the Chat channel.

From the Bot Builder menu, select Overview.

Add a channel to the bot.

In the Channels section, click Add.

For Channel, select Text.

For Deployment, enter your messaging SMS number. If you didn't make note of it when you set up the messaging channel, you can find it in Setup. Search for and then select Messaging Settings. Select Channels, and then select Messaging Platform Key.

TIP If you have trouble with the search, try omitting the plus sign from the SMS number. For example, instead of searching for +15145550000, search for 15145550000.

Or, if you're using an embedded service deployment, enter its name. For example, Student Success Chatbot.

Leave Require Agent Online unselected.

Save your changes.

Update the Chatbot's Branding

Configure the chatbot window's general branding on the Embedded Service Deployment page.

See Customize the General Branding for Your Chat Window and Customize Additional Chat Branding in Salesforce Help.

Customize Chat Dialogs

Dialogs are conversation snippets that consist of outgoing messages, questions, actions, and rules. Dialogs control what a chatbot can do.

The Student Success chatbot contains preconfigured dialogs. You can customize them or create your own. Before customizing or creating your own dialogs, see Understand Einstein Bot Dialogs in Salesforce Help.

Activate the Chatbot

After you've configured and customized the Student Success chatbot, activate it.

From the Bot Builder menu, select Overview.

Click Activate.

Now you're ready to implement the chatbot in a messaging channel or on an Experience Cloud site.
